title: Chained Exploits:Advanced Hacking Attacks,Start to Finish(2009)
description:
Chained Exploits: Advanced Hacking Attacks from Start to Finish

Publisher: Addison-Wesley Professional
Language: English
ISBN: 032149881X
Paperback: 312 pages
Date: March 2009
Format: CHM

This is the Safari online edition of the printed book.

The complete guide to today's hard-to-defend chained attacks: performing them and preventing them

Chained exploits are far more complex and far more difficult to defend. Few security or hacking books cover them well and most donÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t cover them at all.

 Now thereÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s a book that brings together start-to-finish information about todayÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s most widespread chained exploitsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“both how to perform them and how to prevent them.

Chained Exploits demonstrates this advanced hacking attack technique through detailed examples that reflect real-world attack strategies, use todayÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s most common attack tools, and focus on actual high-value targets, including credit card and healthcare data.

 Relentlessly thorough and realistic, this book covers the full spectrum of attack avenues, from wireless networks to physical access and social engineering.


Writing for security, network, and other IT professionals, the authors take you through each attack, one step at a time, and then introduce today's most effective countermeasuresÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ both technical and human. Coverage includes:

*Constructing convincing new phishing attacks

and more

Andrew Whitaker, Director of Enterprise InfoSec and Networking for Training Camp, has been featured in The Wall Street Journal and BusinessWeek. He coauthored Penetration Testing and Network Defense. Andrew was a winner of EC Council's Instructor of Excellence Award.

Keatron Evans is President and Chief Security Consultant of Blink Digital Security, LLC, a trainer for Training Camp, and winner of EC Council's Instructor of Excellence Award.

Jack B. Voth specializes in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and perimeter security. He co-owns The Client Server, Inc., and teaches for Training Camp throughout the United States and abroad.
